data.title: Christopher Mende on LinkedIn: #google #googlepublicsector #madison #aotearoa
data.meta_description: Two weeks ago I stepped into the Google Madison office and started a new role with Google Public Sector as the Head of Customer Engineering for a diverse set‚Ä¶ | 66 comments on LinkedIn
data.text:
üéâ Celebrating 25 Years of Google! üéÇ Today, we join the world in celebrating a digital companion that has been there for us through thick and thin - Google! üåê For a quarter of a century, Google has been an indispensable part of our lives. From answering our curious questions to helping us navigate the ever-expanding online universe, Google has been our trusted guide. üöÄ Through the power of innovation and technology, Google has simplified our lives, making information accessible at our fingertips. It has opened doors to learning, creativity, and exploration, inspiring us to dream big and venture into the unknown. üå† As we mark this remarkable milestone, let's express our gratitude to Google for making the world more connected, for enabling us to pursue our passions, and for making the complex simple. üôè Here's to the next 25 years of learning, discovering, and growing with Google! üå±üí° #Google25 #DigitalJourney #Innovation #TechEvolution #ThankYouGoogle

A heartfelt 25th Birthday to Google! As the CEO of Mergen, I am in awe of Google's journey from a dorm room project to a global digital giant. Here's to 25 years of transformational innovation! From Larry Page and Sergey Brin's initial spark with "BackRub" at Stanford, to becoming Yahoo's default search engine and launching game-changing products like YouTube, Android, Gmail, and Google Maps, Google's evolution is truly inspiring. Their story reminds us that dreams can become reality with determination and innovation. Their leadership in AI and strategic acquisitions exemplify their relentless pursuit of progress. As we celebrate Google's milestone today, I am excited for their AI-powered future. Larry Page, a man who turned his dreams into reality, has been named the best CEO in America and leads Google, the most valuable brand in the world. His optimism and vision are lessons for all of us striving to take our businesses to the next level. Here's to Google's past, present, and future - a testament to what innovation and perseverance can achieve. Happy 25th, Google! #Google25 #TechGiant #Innovation #Inspiration #CEO #Happy25th #Motivation #GoogleMilestone #mergenitllc #Google #DreamBig #HappyBirthdayGoogle #Tranformation

As we celebrate Google's 25-year journey from a small dorm room project to a global tech powerhouse, we at Mergen IT are inspired! The innovation, dedication, and sheer resilience of its founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page have transformed a simple search engine into a revolutionary digital giant. Here are some fun and interesting facts we've gathered from Google's incredible journey: - Big dreams can sprout in the smallest places - Google's story began in a garage! - Google was initially called BackRub The power of purpose - The name "Google," representing a gigantic number, encapsulates their mission to organize the boundless information on the web. - Gmail was Launched on April 1st Fool‚Äôs Day in 2004 with many thinking it was a prank. - Investing in the future - Google's commitment to education through scholarships is lighting the path for the next wave of tech pioneers. At Mergen, we're motivated to embrace innovation, stay rooted in our mission, and invest in rising talent. Inspired by Google's journey, we're excited to navigate the unfolding landscape of technology. Here's to another 25 years of disrupting norms and setting benchmarks, Google! #Google25 #HappyBirthdayGoogle #Google #GoogleDoodle #Inspiration #Innovation #Googleat25 #Globaltech #GoogleAnniversary #mergenitllc

#Google25thBirthday Can you imagine a world without #Google? Where would we be without this tech trailblazer that's become ingrained into the fabric of our lives? Yes, Google, this technological giant, has reached the age of 25. This young, successful company has undergone a rollercoaster journey to become the world's largest and most popular search engine today. The fact that we are here now, rapidly consuming information, and this being our profession, is thanks to this young company. Yet Google emerged from humble beginnings. It was once just a plucky start-up, a glimmer in the eyes of two ambitious Stanford students. Through dizzying highs and sobering lows, it grew into the undisputed search engine titan we know today. The future is unwritten. Now it doesn't matter whether Google remains the same 25 years from now or not. It doesn't matter what new technology emerges in the future to replace Google. This name will forever be etched in the history of global technology. so, here's to another 25 years üëë

üéâ Today marks a remarkable milestone in the tech world! üéÇ Google is celebrating its 25th birthday, and what an incredible journey it has been. From a humble search engine to a global tech giant, Google has transformed the way we live, work, and connect. üåç Google has not only revolutionized the way we access information but has also profoundly changed our lives. It's our trusted navigator, our encyclopedia, and our creative playground, all rolled into one. Whether it's finding answers to our questions, connecting with loved ones through Gmail, or exploring new horizons via Google Earth, Google has become an integral part of our daily routines. üí° The impact of Google on education, business, and innovation is immeasurable. It's empowered entrepreneurs, enabling startups to reach global audiences, and it's fueled the curiosity of students and researchers worldwide. Google's suite of tools, from Docs to Drive, has streamlined collaboration and productivity for teams everywhere. üôå Let's take a moment to appreciate the countless ways Google has changed our lives. Happy 25th, Google! ü•≥ Here's to another quarter-century of innovation, creativity, and making the world a better place. Happy Birthday Google! #Google25 #TechMilestone #Innovation #DigitalTransformation

Today marks the 25th birthday of Google! The journey started from garage in Menlo Park where Larry and Sergey first wrote down our mission: to organize the world‚Äôs information and make it universally accessible and useful. And here we are today in the era of AI committed to solving some of the world's biggest challenges and to the original mission. September also marks my four year journey with Google. When I reflect back to my thoughts of my first bikeride at our Mountain View campus, I was blown away by strenght of our culture and our amazing people. Now I can only agree, our people, values and culture have been foundamental for us to become Google of today. Respect the user (or our clients), respect the opportunity and respect each other. And we have a healthy disregard for the impossible - we think 10x and keep challenging each other. Vital for us to keep improving. The values mashed up with passion and drive on clear vision builds unique culture where everyone can play at their best. We know we are all in charge of it personally, but at the same time together. I'm very excited about the future - the biggest technological shift that we will see in our lifetimes. HBD Google - Cheers to the future!ü•≥ #google #values #culture #mission

üéâ I'm absolutely thrilled to share that I've officially joined Google as a Customer Engineer specialized in AI/Machine Learning! This is a dream come true, especially for a millennial like me who's witnessed firsthand the incredible impact Google has had on our lives! Reflecting on those teenage years, witnessing as the internet started to unfold its wonders, the thought of becoming a Googler was simply unimaginable, it was nothing but a dream far away. Yet, here I stand, thanks to a combination of stubborn determination and the belief that dreams are worth chasing! This achievement is not just mine; it's a shared victory. I couldn't have done it without the unwavering support and encouragement of my incredible husband, Cesar. Through every challenge, he stood by my side, always believing in me, even when I doubted it myself. This journey is just as much his accomplishment as it is mine! That‚Äôs why for the Noogler hat's iconic picture, I chose to have my family by my side, the ones who offered a silent yet dedicated encouragement: Cesar, Nikki Sixx and Cyndi Lauper ‚ù§Ô∏èüíõüíöüíôü§ç, they are Googlers (the dogs are Dooglers) just as much as I am! A heartfelt thanks to Carla Letycia, the extraordinary recruiter who recognized the potential in me and paved the way for this life-altering opportunity! Her guidance and support have been invaluable, turning a potential into a reality. Wearing this iconic Noogler hat feels surreal. It's a tangible symbol of a dream fulfilled and a future filled with promise. Google‚Äôs value of respect, of giving people a voice and a chance, resonates deeply with me. It aligns perfectly with my own beliefs and that‚Äôs the reason I‚Äôm here in the first place, Lety gave me a chance and now Google has given me a voice. This is all the ethos that has guided me on this path! Here's to embracing change, daring to dream big, and to the incredible journey ahead. I'm eager to contribute my part to the legacy of innovation that Google represents! I also must thank every fellow Googler who are making this journey incredible, I‚Äôm just beyond joy! üöÄ #Noogler #Google #GoogleCloud #machinelearning #artificialintelligence

ùüÆùü± ùó≥ùóÆùó∞ùòÅùòÄ ùóÆùóØùóºùòÇùòÅ ùóöùóºùóºùó¥ùóπùó≤ ùó≥ùóºùóø ùó∂ùòÅùòÄ ùüÆùü±ùòÅùóµ ùóïùó∂ùóøùòÅùóµùó±ùóÆùòÜ üéÇ 1. Google was officially founded in September 1998 2. It was founded in a rented garage in Silicon Valley 3. Jeff Bezos was one of the earliest investors 4. The Google.com domain was registered in 1997 already 5. Google‚Äôs original name was BackRub 6. ‚ÄúGoogle‚Äù is A reference to ‚Äúgoogol‚Äù (10 raised to the power of 100) 7. The 1st indexed website was Larry Pages‚Äô Stanford website 8. Stanford University still owns the patent to Google‚Äôs original search algorithm 9. Today Google.com is available in 80+ languages 10. Google.com is the world‚Äôs most visited website 11. Over 8.5BN searches take place every day 12. 15% of all searches are new every day 13. The word ‚ÄúGoogle‚Äù was officially recognized as a verb in 2006 14. Today Google‚Äôs HQ is in Mountain View, CA 15. Since 2015 Alphabet Inc. is Google‚Äôs parent company 16. Google has 9 products with over 1BN monthly active users 17. Google has 180.000+ employees worldwide 18. There are over 70 offices in 50+ countries 19. The 1st international office opened in Tokyo in 2001 20. Google offers its employees free food and snacks at every office 21. Google‚Äôs employees are called Googlers 22. New Employees are called Nooglers 23. Office dogs are called Dooglers 24. Google has had dog-friendly offices from day 1 25. There‚Äôs an internal feature testing program call ‚Äúdogfood‚Äù #lifeatgoogle #onlinemarketing #google #anniversary

I‚Äôm regularly sharing experiences about my job and my career at Google. üôÇ #lifeatgoogle #onlinemarketing #google #anniversary
